intro: Bergeranthus rehneltianus, commonly known as the red-veined daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are dark green and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Bergeranthus rehneltianus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in garden settings with proper care.
